MGT2.Title: Mongoose Traveller 2e
MGT2.Settings.Verbose.Name: Verbose Skill Rolls
MGT2.Settings.Verbose.Hint: Displays effect and chain results of skill rolls.
MGT2.Settings.ChatIcons.Name: Use Chat Icons
MGT2.Settings.ChatIcons.Hint: Displays avatars of the character in skill rolls.
MGT2.Settings.QuickRolls.Name: Default to Quick Rolls
MGT2.Settings.QuickRolls.Hint: Reverse the use of click and shift-click for skill rolls.
MGT2.Settings.SkillColumns.Name: Number of skill columns
MGT2.Settings.SkillColumns.Hint: Number of columns to split character skill lists into.
MGT2.Settings.SkillFormat.Name: Skill list format
MGT2.Settings.SkillFormat.Hint: Format of skill lists, either row first or column first
MGT2.Settings.UseEncumbrance.Name: Use encumbrance
MGT2.Settings.UseEncumbrance.Hint: If enabled, automatically applies penalties due to encumbrance
MGT2.Settings.CurrentYear.Name: Year
MGT2.Settings.CurrentYear.Hint: The current year of the campaign
MGT2.Settings.CurrentDay.Name: Day
MGT2.Settings.CurrentDay.Hint: The current day of the campaign
MGT2.Settings.AutoResizeSpacecraft.Name: Resize spacecraft tokens
MGT2.Settings.AutoResizeSpacecraft.Hint: Size of tokens for spacecraft are automatically set according to their tonnage
MGT2.Settings.PlayerSheetNotification.Hi: Who to send chat messages to when a player rolls their characteristics
MGT2.Settings.GMSheetNotification.Name: GM sheet update broadcasts
MGT2.Settings.GMSheetNotification.Hint: Who to send chat messages to when a GM rolls an actor's characteristics
MGT2.Settings.PlayerVision.Traveller.Hin: Default vision setting for Traveller tokens
MGT2.Settings.PlayerVision.NPC.Name: NPC token vision
MGT2.Settings.PlayerVision.NPC.Hint: Default vision setting for NPC tokens
MGT2.Settings.PlayerVision.Creature.Name: Creature token vision
MGT2.Settings.PlayerVision.Creature.Hint: Default vision setting for Creature tokens
MGT2.Settings.PlayerVision.Spacecraft.Hi: Default vision setting for Spacecraft/Vehicle tokens
MGT2.Settings.BlastEffectDivergence.Name: Blast effect divergence distance
MGT2.Settings.BlastEffectDivergence.Hint: If an attack roll with a blast effect misses, how far to diverge blast template from intended location
MGT2.Settings.SplitAttackDamage.Name: Split attack and damage rolls
MGT2.Settings.SplitAttackDamage.Hint: Rather than rolling damage with an attack, require a second button click to roll damage
MGT2.Settings.DefaultTraveller.Name: Default Traveller
MGT2.Settings.DefaultTraveller.Hint: Name of Traveller actor to use for default skills and settings
MGT2.Settings.AutoPlayerCharacter.Name: Auto set player character
MGT2.Settings.AutoPlayerCharacter.Hint: If a player creates a new character, automatically set it as their default if they don't yet have a default
MGT2.TravellerSheet.RandomRoll: Re-roll characteristics (shift for average, ctrl for vary)
MGT2.WorldSheet.DropBroker: Drop actor to set ship broker
MGT2.WorldSheet.DropStreetwise: Drop actor to set ship streetwise
MGT2.WorldSheet.TradeFolderHint: Name of folder of cargo items to use as speculative trade goods on this world
MGT2.WorldSheet.DropStreetwise: Drop actor to set ship streetwise
MGT2.WorldSheet.Hydrographics.Descriptio: Only a few islands and archipelagos
MGT2.WorldSheet.Law.Weapons.1: Poison gas, explosives, undetectable weapons, WMD
MGT2.WorldSheet.Law.Weapons.4: Light assault weapons and submachine guns
MGT2.WorldSheet.Law.Weapons.6: All firearms except shotguns and stunners; carrying weapons discouraged
MGT2.TravellerSheet.DragCargo: Cargo hold is empty. Drag cargo here to fill it.
MGT2.TravellerSheet.DragShip: Drag spacecraft here to add them.
MGT2.TravellerSheet.DragVehicle: Drag vehicles here to add them.
MGT2.Creature.BehaviourText.chaser: Kills their prey after a long chase, such as wolves
MGT2.Creature.BehaviourText.eater: Eats anything they encounter, like ants
MGT2.Creature.BehaviourText.filter: Herbivores that pass matter through themselves, like earthworms
MGT2.Creature.BehaviourText.gatherer: Herbivores that collect and store food
MGT2.Creature.BehaviourText.grazer: Grazing animals, often live in herds
MGT2.Creature.BehaviourText.hijacker: Scavenger that steal the kills of others via force
MGT2.Creature.BehaviourText.intimidator: Scavenger that claims kills via intimidation
MGT2.Creature.BehaviourText.intermittent: Herbivores that don't spend all their time grazing
MGT2.Creature.BehaviourText.pouncer: Predators that stalk and ambush prey
MGT2.Creature.BehaviourText.reducer: Scavenger that devours remains left by others
MGT2.Spacecraft.ExtendedDriveTitle:
Select this if the drive needs to move
more than just the ship.
Drop tanks, external cargo or craft
MGT2.DamageDialog.Title: Apply Damage
MGT2.Damage.Wound.CripplingEffect: Location out of action and suffers permanent damage.
MGT2.Damage.Wound.CriticalEffect: Location out of action and suffers permanent damage
MGT2.Spacecraft.CriticalEffects.Damage: {name} takes an extra {hits} hits from critical
MGT2.Spacecraft.CriticalEffects.SensorMa: Critical hit on {name} limits sensors to {range} range
MGT2.Spacecraft.CriticalEffects.WeaponDa: Weapon {name} is damaged, -1 to attack rolls
MGT2.Spacecraft.CriticalEffects.WeaponDi: Weapon {name} is damaged, out of use
MGT2.Item.WeaponTrait.Text.artillery: Can be used against targets out of sight
MGT2.Item.WeaponTrait.Text.silent: DM-6 to detect sound of weapon
MGT2.Item.WeaponTrait.Text.chainReaction: Continues to do damage in following rounds
MGT2.Item.WeaponTrait.Text.orbitalStrike: DM-12 to attack ships, Blast 100 v ground targets
MGT2.Item.WeaponTrait.Text.orbitalBombar: DM-8 to attack ships, no Blast trait v ground targets
MGT2.Item.WeaponTrait.Text.spinal: Damage reduced by armour as percentage
MGT2.Attack.DragMe: Drag to character sheet, or click to apply to selected tokens.
MGT2.Attack.DragMeBlast: Drag to canvas to show blast radius

MGT2.Attack.PsionicAP: +{pp} to AP for each point spent, base {ap}

MGT2.Item.Hardware.Tonnage.Title.costByH: Cost is based on size of ship
MGT2.Item.Hardware.Tonnage.Title.costByR: Cost is based on rating of the item

MGT2.EditSkill.Individual: Individual skill, each specialisation must be individually trained
MGT2.EditSkill.Deleted: Deleted, will be removed from target actor when package is applied
